title: Caribbean island of Carriacou ‘flattened’ after Hurricane Beryl makes landfall
content: Though there were no immediate reports of deaths or injuries, Grenadian Prime Minister Dickon Mitchell warned: “That may change quickly. ... In half an hour, Carriacou was flattened.”
summary: Though there were no immediate reports of deaths or injuries, Grenadian Prime Minister Dickon Mitchell warned: “That may change quickly. ... In half an hour, Carriacou was flattened.”

title: What happens next in French elections as far right leads in first vote
content: France’s far-right National Rally party hopes to win an outright majority in National Assembly elections after a second round of voting.
summary: France’s far-right National Rally party hopes to win an outright majority in National Assembly elections after a second round of voting.

title: Head of Gaza’s al-Shifa Hospital released after months of detention
content: Pulled from a U.N. convoy, Mohamed Abu Salmiya’s detention bookended one of the most indelible chapters of Israel’s nine-month military operation in Gaza.
summary: Pulled from a U.N. convoy, Mohamed Abu Salmiya’s detention bookended one of the most indelible chapters of Israel’s nine-month military operation in Gaza.

title: E.U. says Meta’s ‘pay or consent’ ads violate competition law
content: Regulators say the tech giant breached the Digital Markets Act in requiring Instagram and Facebook users to pay if they don’t want personal data used to generate targeted ads.
summary: Regulators say the tech giant breached the Digital Markets Act in requiring Instagram and Facebook users to pay if they don’t want personal data used to generate targeted ads.

title: Hurricane Beryl tracker: Map and projected storm path
content: Beryl is expected to bring life-threatening winds and storm surge to the Windward Islands.
summary: Beryl is expected to bring life-threatening winds and storm surge to the Windward Islands.

title: Russia’s devastating glide bombs keep falling on its own territory
content: Internal Russian documents show how often its glide bombs hit its own territory, likely due to faulty guidance systems, say experts.
summary: Internal Russian documents show how often its glide bombs hit its own territory, likely due to faulty guidance systems, say experts.

title: With ‘Make Europe Great Again,’ Hungary taunts allies, touts hard right
content: Hungary takes up the rotating presidency of the Council of the European Union on Monday, putting the spotlight on Prime Minister Viktor Orban.
summary: Hungary takes up the rotating presidency of the Council of the European Union on Monday, putting the spotlight on Prime Minister Viktor Orban.

title: A 28-year-old is the face of France’s far right: Who is Jordan Bardella?
content: Bardella joined the National Rally at 16 and was elected its president in 2022. He could become prime minister if his party wins an upcoming vote.
summary: Bardella joined the National Rally at 16 and was elected its president in 2022. He could become prime minister if his party wins an upcoming vote.

title: What Taiwan is learning from the war in Ukraine
content: For the Taiwanese public, the Russian invasion of Ukraine has revealed the dangers at their own doorstep, said Taiwan’s de facto ambassador in Washington.
summary: For the Taiwanese public, the Russian invasion of Ukraine has revealed the dangers at their own doorstep, said Taiwan’s de facto ambassador in Washington.

title: French election projections show voters punishing Macron’s centrists, boosting far right
content: Snap legislative elections could end French President Emmanuel Macron’s centrist political experiment and bring Marine Le Pen’s far-right party to power.
summary: Snap legislative elections could end French President Emmanuel Macron’s centrist political experiment and bring Marine Le Pen’s far-right party to power.

title: Gaza’s remaining hospitals will stop working in two days, health officials warn
content: Israel’s closure of the vital Rafah border crossing last month severed key supply lines, aid groups warned. Fighting goes on in Shejaiya, Gaza City, the IDF said.
summary: Israel’s closure of the vital Rafah border crossing last month severed key supply lines, aid groups warned. Fighting goes on in Shejaiya, Gaza City, the IDF said.

title: How one family escaped North Korea in a rickety boat on the open sea
content: Almost no one has been able to defect from North Korea since Kim Jong Un shut the borders in 2020. But this family made a terrifying bid for freedom — and succeeded.
summary: Almost no one has been able to defect from North Korea since Kim Jong Un shut the borders in 2020. But this family made a terrifying bid for freedom — and succeeded.
